Column Comment.0: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.
Column Comment.1: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CARTER SURVEY INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels are describedusing the Carter Survey System.
Column Comment.4: CONGRESS REFERENCE INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels aredescribed using the Congress Survey System.
Column Comment.5: COORD ACQUISITION: identifies an assembly of coordinate data that must begrouped together. It should be acquired together at the same time, from the samesource, using the same method and at the same accuracy. May be used to indicatethe level of accuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.6: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.7: DOMINION SURVEY SYSTEM INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcelsare described using the DLS Survey System.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.10: FPS INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels are described using theFederal Permit System.
Column Comment.11: GEODETIC REFERENCE INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels aredescribed using the Geodetic Reference System.
Column Comment.12: GROSS SIZE: Total amount of land measured in hectares/acres in the land legaldescription
Column Comment.13: GROSS SIZE OUOM: Usually hectares or acres
Column Comment.14: INACTIVATION DATE: Date on which the tract was actually inactivated. Not thesame as expiry date, which is the date on which the primary term of the agreementends.
Column Comment.15: LIBYA INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that a survey description exists in theLibyan system.
Column Comment.16: LINE INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that this spatial description contains a lineardescription in the table SP_LINE.
Column Comment.17: LINE POINT VERSION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that a row of data existsfor locations in the table SP LINE POINT VERSION. Used to assist performance.
Column Comment.18: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.19: MAXIMUM LATITUDE: Maximum latitude of the Bounding box for the spatialdescription
Column Comment.20: MAXIMUM LONGITUDE: Maximum longitude of the Bounding box for the spatialdescription
Column Comment.21: MINERAL ZONE INDICATOR: indicates that this land legal description is describedby mineral zones.
Column Comment.22: MINIMUM LATITIDE: Maximum latitude of the Bounding box for the spatialdescription
Column Comment.23: MINIMUM LONGITUDE Minimum longitude of the Bounding box for the spatialdescription
Column Comment.24: NE LOC IND: NE LOCATION INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels aredescribed using the NE location System.
Column Comment.25: NORTH SEA INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels are described usingthe North Sea reference System.
Column Comment.26: NTS INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels are described using theNational Topographic System.
Column Comment.27: OFFSHORE INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels are described usingthe Offshore reference System.
Column Comment.28: OHIO INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that a record exists in the Ohio surveysystem.
Column Comment.29: PUBLIC LAND BLOCK INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels aredescribed using the PBL reference System.
Column Comment.30: POINT INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this spatial description issupported with locations that are point geometries.
Column Comment.31: POINT VERSION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that a row of data exists forlocations in the table SP POINT VERSION. Used to assist performance.
Column Comment.32: POLYGON INDICATOR: Indicates that this land legal description is described by oneor more polygons.
Column Comment.33: POLYGON BOUNDARY VERSION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that a row ofdata exists for locations in the table SP BOUNDARY VERSION. Used to assistperformance.
Column Comment.34: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.35: REFERENCE NUMBER: An identifier or name sometimes given to spatialdescriptions, such as Tract numbers assigned to the description of a bundle of rightsby a regulatory agency.
Column Comment.36: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.37: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.38: SPATIAL TEXT DESCRIPTION INDICATOR: indicates that the land legal descriptionis described by a textual description, such as metes and bounds.
Column Comment.39: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION TYPE: The type of description. May be for a land right,surface restriction, pool, field, spacing unit etc.
Column Comment.40: TEXAS INDICATOR: used to indicate that the land parcels are described using theTexas Survey System.
Column Comment.41: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.42: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.43: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.44: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.45: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.46: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.47: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
